miscarriage.overview: Bleeding/cramps may be heaviest. Rest, hydrate, and follow your care plan.
Bleeding and cramping often ease. Gentle movement and warm drinks can help.
Light spotting can linger; energy slowly returns. Mood waves are normal.
Many finish bleeding now. First period may return anytime in 4–8 weeks.
Hormones settle; sleep and steady meals support your mood and energy.
If advised, complete follow-up. Ease back to usual activity at your pace.
Strength rebuilds; try light exercise or stretching if it feels comfortable.
Many feel physically recovered; feelings can still ebb and flow—be gentle.

abortion.overview: Cramping and bleeding are common; rest, hydrate, and be gentle with yourself.
Bleeding usually lightens; pregnancy symptoms often begin to fade.
Light spotting can linger; simple routines (sleep, meals, short walks) help steadiness.
Most bleeding ends; a first period may return in 4–8 weeks, and fertility can return sooner.
Energy often improves; check in with emotions and lean on support you trust.
Many feel physically recovered; keep following any after-care guidance that fits your plan.
Strength continues to rebuild; gentle movement and hydration can support your mood.
Many feel physically settled; feelings may still ebb and flow—go at your own pace.
